content:
Currently core::future::Pending<T> is Send only when T is Send. This is due to PhantomData<T> used inside.

But since Pending<T> never actually holds or produces Ts, this restriction is not necessary. Can we relax this?
we could relax it to PhantomData<fn() -> T>, since that's basically what it is
It's already relaxed on nightly (will be part of rustc 1.60, it's my own PR: #92630)
Gah, I knew this got done already. :laughing: I was about to tag @Frank Steffahn and say that they did something similar in a PR a while back.
I tried being exhaustive at the time. I searched for PhantomData<Ident> with regexes throughout the standard library IIRC and reviewed everything I came across.
